pr_title: Support being able to set the theme for the paper / card elements

timeline.message:
Support being able to set the background colors of cards

This further improves the ability to setup a dark theme.

EBP: Support using alternate card background colors

This also highlighted that the primaryTextColor was not being used in the EBP cards; and, while addressing that added more consistent Material UI styling.

timeline.author: ChristianMurphy

replies.bodyText:
This syntax is indeed new to me.
From what I understand, all this will do is ensure that nothing remains for the interface after compilation time. But isn't that the case already?
replies.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
In some cases.
If a module is side-effect free, tree shakers and bundlers can automatically import only the types and exclude the code.
However, if there is a side-effect in the module, a tree-shaker can't determine if the side-effect is intended or not, so it will include the code just in case.
The import type annotation tells the tooling to ignore any side effects and only pull the types.
replies.author: ChristianMurphy

replies.bodyText: Not sure I follow though. There is no code for an interface. Is there any chance you could point to an example or something?
replies.author: edalex-ian
ChristianMurphy

replies.bodyText: Aaaaahhhh!!! Now I got it. Thank you. 👍
replies.author: edalex-ian
